In 2028, maybe it's somebody who hasn't ordered in a week.
So I think being able to have those inputs would be great.

And then those accounts are categorized by prospect.

If they're an account we know of, but we're not working with yet, a target, an account that we know of and we're trying to get them to buy, but they haven't bought yet, and then a current account that's an account that's actively doing business with us.
So they can sort here and then however they like or sort by territory and then they can create, what they do is they create a call plan by checking the box.
So if this is how they'll say, okay, who am I going to visit next week?
So they go through and they do this and then they filter on the checked boxes and that's their list of who they're going to get in touch with each week.
And so by requiring that they go through and they do this review of their entire account list once a week and they specifically pick which accounts they're going to try to contact.
And then of course they're supposed to put like a three to five word objective, but if we had a proxy for this in the tool, I mean, it would be unbelievably powerful.
And then they can go through and just check it off as they go.
Which is what we recommend that they do with this, is they either print this off or they go through and update.
And so at the end of the week, if they have a call plan that's completely checked off, then they've completed their objectives.
And this then is used to populate the calendar.
So it's the one piece that fits in between like who's my account list and what's on my calendar.
Creating that call plan is the, is bridging those two.
And then they could of course just execute what's on their calendar.
So yeah, having a proxy for that here and then those objectives and as they action that call plan, turning those into objectives.

So if, let's say you had your call plan and it was a list of all of the customers and they go through and click like add activity against the account on that and then that would take them to the page where they can either enter activity or they can speak it into the phone.
That would be groundbreaking.
Right?

Just getting our reps the way that they do it now, honestly, they're taking notes into a notebook and then from that notebook we have to beg and plead them to transcribe it or to just use their iPad and put it directly into the CRM at the time that they're doing it.

Once routes have been published, they can go through, look at the routes and they can tell their customers, hey, by the way, your order is going to be there roughly such and such time.
